All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
App
Main driver object of this game.
Audio
An abstract object that manages the playback of audio files.
CollisionChecker
This class is used to check collisions between entities and objects
ConfigFile
Contains data for game settings such as volume of music and soundeffects, fullscreen status and stores high scores.
CreditsInput
Handles input from the player's keyboard in the Credits state.
CreditsScreen
Used to draw the credits screen.
Entity
Abstract class Entity is the super class of farmer (enemies) and player This class has some general stats for enemies and player such as X and Y coordinates, speed, hitbox, etc.
Farmer
An entity called Farmer which is the main enemy of the game.
GamePanel
Manages and controls all the systems involved with the game.
InputHandler
Handles input from the player's keyboard.
InputManager
Manages the input handlers for each game state.
LoseScreen
Used to draw the game over screen.
Map
Reads and stores the level data for one map file.
MapManager
Stores each map for the game and manages progression between them.
Music
Manages and controls music tracks used by this game.
Node
Node that represents a tile used in the Pathfinding class Stores various information about the ttile such as location, costs for pathfinding algorithm, collision status, etc.
OBJ_Egg
Egg object restores the player's health by one if their health is not full or gives the player 100 points.
OBJ_Gate
Gate object only lets the player advance to the next level after they pick up the required number of keys for that level.
OBJ_Heart
Heart object that is used to display player health onto the screen.
OBJ_Key
Key object that the player must collect in order to advance to the next level.
OBJ_NonFuncGate
Gate object that does not function.
OBJ_NonFuncStoneGate
 
OBJ_StoneGate
 
OBJ_Trap
Trap object that damages the player upon collision.
ObjectManager
Manages the spawning of game objects.
Pathfinding
Creates and sets Nodes to represent the tiles of the map player and farmers are on Also stores potential paths and the eventual final path towards the farmers goal location Once these tiles are stored in Nodes, the A-star pathfinding algorithm can be used to find the fastest path farmer can take to player Accounts for solid obstacles on the map such as trees and fenches, paths around them Only allows for up, down, left, right movement as per assignment instructions Needs to be instantiated in GamePanel to be called by Farmer in the future
PauseInput
Handles input from the player's keyboard in the Pause state.
PauseScreen
Used to draw the pause screen.
Player
Manages the player's stats, sprites and interactions.
PlayInput
Handles input from the player's keyboard on the Play state.
PlayScreen
Used to draw the user interface during gameplay onto the screen.
Settings
Contains the logic to read and write data from settings.json configuration file.
SettingsInput
Handles input from the player's keyboard in the Settings state.
SettingsScreen
Used to draw the settings screen.
SoundEffects
Controls and manages sound effects for the game.
StateManager
Manages and controls the differing game states of our game.
StateManager.gameState
 
SuperObject
Abstract class for game objects that contains the objects properties.
Tile
Tiles make up the entire map and are the core of the game These are what objects sit on and entities move on There will be many different types of tiles, some with collision and some just for decoration image is the current tiles image (grass, fence, water, flowers, etc.)
TileManager
This class manages the tiles by setting their images and keeping track of their collision status It also creates the main array of tiles that is used to draw the map and place objects
TitleInput
Handles input from the player's keyboard in the Title state.
TitleScreen
Used to draw the title screen.
UI
Contains the base attributes and methods for each game screen corresponding to each game state.
UIManager
Manages the user interface depending on the current state of the game.
WinLoseInput
Handles input from the player's keyboard in the Win/Lose states.
WinScreen
Used to draw the win screen.
